website_summaries.verdict: An external hard drive from LaCie with a rugged, high quality build.
pros: Rubber edges keep the hard drive protected from drops and scrapes
Comes with several different connection options including the fast Thunderbolt USB-C
cons: Hard drive suffers from slow speeds and hang ups when using photo editing software

customer_reviews.title: A Good Drive, But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drive as an external drive for photo editing in Lightroom. It is a great drive, but is not nearly as fast as indicated in the description when you are moving thousands of small files around. Pros: - Great capacity to price ratio - As a backup drive, it is really fast for a spinning disk - It really will survive a waist high drop Cons: - Really slow in Lightroom - even with USB-C If this review was helpful to you, please click the "yes" button below - it helps Amazon (and those of us who write reviews) know if the information provided is of value to others.
customer_reviews.author: Carl O'DayTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: So rugged it won't even survive shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This "Rugged" Drive didn't even survive shipping. This is the second LaCie drive I have had, and come to think of it my first one failed too. Unit would not mount on either my Mac or my PC. Drive was not visible via disk management and was beeping constantly. RMA'd and will be ordering a Western Digital drive. I am done buying these overpriced, overrated drives.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Not Rugged at all!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was "Rugged". I've dropped my much cheaper Seagate multiple times and never had a problem. The La Cie Rugged fell off my couch onto carpeted floor and is dead. Can't access any files and crashes my computer. Total waste of money and very disappointed. I lost an entire wedding I had just edited, around 20 hours of work. Thankfully I had all my RAW files backed up and still on the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never again!!!
customer_reviews.text: I went through 3 of these over a period of about 18 months. They all failed over a short period of time. Lost the info on it (which was photos of my children sadly.) I HIGHLY suggest you look into another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Swain

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble, would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Drive worked fine when it was delivered. I had it running overnight a few times transferring data. No problems. I didn't use it for a week and now it won't mount. I have tried it with 4 different computers and multiple different cords. It's getting power, you can hear and feel the disk spinning. I have two other LaCie 1TB drives and they both are still running well. No idea whats going on, kind of turned me off this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Owens

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Died after less than 6 months... Everything was working fine until I left it plugged in to my computer, I was uploading stuff to the cloud... When I came back, the Hard drive was making weird noises and I noticed it was not recognized by my computer. I restarted my machine, tried with 3 different Macs, 2 different cables and nothing... It just doesn't work. It still turns on but unrecognizable by any computer, only makes weird sounds like scratching and bleeping and the LED blinks fast... Never had a HD that failed after such short time. I don't think I'm ever buying LaCie or Seagate products again... I may have lost all my data...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product says “water resistant” that wasn’t the case in my experience...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Nov 18th 2017. I’m a DJ and was at an outside gig when the weather took a turn and got rained out. The ext drive suffered some water damage. I was reading about the 3 yr limited warranty and product which states it’s “water resistant” well apparently not cause now when i plug in the drive it just makes a beeping sound it’s not clicking which could be worse. I packed up the equipment as quickly as possible so I didn’t think the rain affected it that much but it doesn’t even boot up on my laptop anymore. So much for being “water resistant”
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Second time having issues with a La Cie product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item less than 5 months ago. I transferred all my photos on it for safe keeping. I was getting warning signs that something was not right after just a few months but believed the problem to be with the USB cables. Three months in the drive stopped working. I took it to a local computer repair store to have them retrieve my 3,000+ photos but they were unable to get anything. The drive was shipped off and now I am waiting to see if a company that apparently has more resources can retrieve any of the photos. My price will be between $550 and $1500. This has turned out to be a very expensive external HD.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Likes to Drop Dead
customer_reviews.text: I am a wedding photographer and I had one of these drives totally go dead on me. You can imagine the panic. The cost of me recovering 5tb of memory would have been so expensive but the plus side was it was under 6 months old so was covered by their warranty. The downside - THE DRIVE DIED WITHIN 6 MONTHS. So they ship me another one, free of charge. Awesome! Except that one stopped working, this time on the second usage! If you are a professional, or are using this to store priceless data - DO NOT BUY THIS. DO NOT THIS USE.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. THIS PRODUCT IS USELESS
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute trash. Its SO bad that Lacie had to replace it within only a few weeks of my original pruchase. They had the never to try and charge me to ship it back after it stopped working. Now here we are less than a year later and the replacement drive is dead. They refuse to refund my money and I now how to see if they can retrieve my data. SAVE YOUR MONEY GET CLOUD DATA storage its way cheaper and more reliable. Seagate's "support" all the way up to their Supervisor is polite but useless, and they do not stand by their products.
customer_reviews.author: E. Venuto

customer_reviews.title: As far as the drive goes there are no problems ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I started having connection problems with the cord it would get moved slightly and then it would fail and I’d have to re open it. I then ordered a replacement cord and then the drive itself started to make squeaking noises and then fail again. I’m a photographer and I run editing software off of the drive so it’s really inconvienent and I don’t know how to go about getting my money back or getting a replacement. Very hesitant to use this brand again after hearing such good things about it
customer_reviews.author: Ashley speca

customer_reviews.title: USB-C Cable NOT self Contained - Slow performance
customer_reviews.text: This drive has an Apple Thunderbolt cable permanently attached and tucked away in the case. The Dell "Thunderbolt 3" connection uses the same physical connection as USB-C. This requires an extra cable. Fortunately, it is included. However, it is not self contained in the package and can easily be lost. Update: While copying data to this drive using USB-C, I noticed it is quite slow in both read & writes. I tested it with Crysztal Disk Mark 6 and the results were verified. About half the speed of an internal drive.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: LaCie is just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other brands of external hard disks, but this brand is certainly true to its name. It's sturdy, not too heavy, but it's easy to see all the protection that's built around it. It easily worked with my Mac and I will order another drive, I like it that much. My last external drive from another brand (plastic exterior only) was destroyed and the data could not be retrieved after it suffered a three-foot drop onto a concrete floor. Although I don't plan to drop this device, it looks like it would survive and and not destroy my data.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Think Twice
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a couple of months and it was great until one day it just stopped working - every photographer's worst nightmare. It costs 10x the hard drive cost to recover the data. I have the warranty on the drive itself but that you have so send in your drive first, meaning you have to have a spare drive as well to put your recovered data on. At this point, I just want a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built tougher than Ford!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I can say enough good things about this drive. I purchased this particular drive 2 years ago, as I needed additional space. I had previously bought the 1T and 2T drives, all with good experiences. I have since dropped this drive numerous times, and have managed to accidentally drown my drive in very hot water for over a minute, and the DRIVE STILL WORKED! Like I said, cannot say enough good things. As a graphic designer and digiscrapper, I'm entrusting my life on this drive and it has been worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Pretty and colorful, but it's still a Seagate. Anytime I have accidentally pulled the cable out before ejection, the unit craps and I can no longer upload anything onto it. This has happened at least twice. I know it's my fault if I unplug it before I eject it, but this is happened on other hard drives before and there was no problem. It works, but it sucks that I have to be extra delicate with it unless I want to unload everything on it and then put it back on, or risk losing everything if I don't have the space available to offload the data to another device.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Davis

customer_reviews.title: Why not a real USB-C version?
customer_reviews.text: was really disappointed in this, but wanted to love it. The good: The drive is tough, the rubber is thick, and it's clear it can take a beating. What I didn't like was I specifically orderde the USB-C version, but instead received what was essentially a firewire version, with an extra dongle for USB-C. The best selling point for me was the integrated cable management, nothing sticking out and nothing to lose.... you can't replace the fixed hard-wired Firewire cable, left with a dongle to lose, that sticks out and is sure to get broken.
customer_reviews.author: Justin V.

customer_reviews.title: Lacie Fan disappointed in this 5TB HD. Do Not Risk Your Data!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to believe that this is a Lacie drive. I should have looked at the reviews and would have never ordered it. But I have been a long time user of Lacie hard drives, storying my DJ music and music videos. I have two 2TB drives and a 1.5TB drive. This one failed after 1 week, after loading 4TB of music videos on it. I am thankful I had two backup's on two WD drives after this failed. Because I would not have been happy. Now I don't know if I should trust the ones I have, or are the 5TB one's just aren't made up to their standards. Sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Danny T

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Item was decent until it suddenly stopped working after 4 months, not able to retrieve my files they're gone forever 😧😭
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: RE: Horrible experience, will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as many other photographers raved about them. I guess mine was a lemon? No drops, no spills, used twice and in the first week of having it, it malfunctioned and now cannot be read by my iMac. I've tried to return via Amazon AND LaCie but ran in circles trying to figure out how to get a replacement or at least a refund. Nothing. Now I am stuck with this thing that doesn't even work.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: Worse than worthless
customer_reviews.text: Buy at your own risk! We bought this for our college-bound daughter as her professor recommended it for backup and portability of her photography work. Unfortunately, after two months of use, the thing simply died and everything stored is hopelessly lost with less than a month before her grand thesis project and exhibition is due. Some work was saved on the school’s hard drive, but so much has been lost which is very stressful and could possibly result in a lower grade.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy - NJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fast and high capacity
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a back-up drive. I love the soft padding around the case, the fast transfer speed, and the large capacity. This is my 5th (?) LaCie drive, and all have been robust and flawless. BTW, I can't give a review on their tech support because I have never needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of normal use, this product just stopped working. I call Lacie for assistance and was told I would have to pay $49 plus $650 for data recovery. The technician also told me I should've backed up my files on another device! REALLY!!! I'm now trying to find an electronic store to assist me with recovering my data (family photos, videos, and personal files). I will NEVER purchase another Lacie product.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE 4 EXTERNAL LACIE HARD DRIVES AND everyone single ONE OF THEM DEVELOPED AN ISSUE WITH THE HARD DRIVE CONNECTOR FACE. Woobbvly. Insecure. Could not work from hard drive without it docopnnecting. Contacted LACie and they said they never had this problem from customer in the past. I found it weird that I have 4 LACIE external rugged drives and 3 of them have this issue. Will NEVER BUY LACIE product again.
customer_reviews.author: AKA

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Only 6 Months and then Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive for my son because it looked rugged and I thought it would last for awhile. It worked fine for about 6 months and then stopped working. It wasn't dropped or misused. I think the orange foam packaging gives the impression it is a tough unit, but it appears to be for marketing purposes only. I wouldn't recommend the product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and Fails Constantly
customer_reviews.text: This drive has been faulty from day 1. It only works intermittently and recently it won't work at all. It has overheated multiple times and won't connect to my computer on multiple occasions. (it's a great way to start the day by spending an hour trying to get this hard drive to connect) As a professional photographer I was excited for this portable hard drive but now all I want is a refund so I can buy one from another producer. This drive does not live up to rugged.. the only thing "rugged" about it is the process of getting it to work. - The only positive is it has an SD card reader within the hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Debenedetto

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with Time Machine on Mac Catalina
customer_reviews.text: This is the second LaCie in a row to fail almost immediately. Plug the drive in and it mounts. Open Time Machine. Time Machine asks to erase and format. Click OK and then I get the message "POSIX reports: The operation couldn't be completed. Invalid argument." Drive disappears from desktop. Go to Disk Utility and drive shows up as disk3s2 and is unmounted. Won't mount. Run Disk First Aid and it immediately comes back with operation failed. Seagate tech support was exceptional! Amazon sent a new drive and same thing happens again. Going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Whippoorwill

customer_reviews.title: I thought LaCie drives were good?
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed this drive, followed manufacturer's instructions...nothing works. Not recognized by my MacBook Pro running OS 10.15 and could not be found by Disk Utility. Bought a WD Wireless Passport Pro, which works perfectly. Also, the ad for the LaCie drive lists a free month of Adobe Cloud...unfortunately, that offer expired a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: pasqual

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Connect to Powerbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: The built in cable is regular Thunderbolt cable, not a Thunderbolt 3 which the Powerbook Pro needs. This drive comes with a cable to connect to a Powerbook Pro. It's a cheap crappy one just by looking at it but it also doesn't work at all. I was afraid it was the port but thankfully the port works with another cable I have. BEWARE, like me you may need another $25 cable just to use this ... and then what do you do with the dangling cable that's useless to me and built into the drive? Unhappy about this "compatible" drive. It's not REALLY.
customer_reviews.author: kitty

customer_reviews.title: Keeps ejecting on its own
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, and be rugged, but I keep getting an alert that this drive was improperly ejected. Either there's something wrong with the software, or the usb connection is a little loose. Either way, it has caused me to have to restart file transfers almost every time I've transferred a large number of files, and if I hadn't been paying attention and had planned on having it done when I looked back (I transport large files between working locations and sometimes set up a transfer, walk away for the 10-20 minutes, and then come back to eject the drive and take it with me), I could have lost a lot of valuable time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Guzewich

customer_reviews.title: Crashed two months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Only two months after purchase, this device refused to disconnect from computer and then erased all data on the device when I manually disconnected the cord. Would not recommend. At startup, don't format the device to be readable on both Mac and Windows. I did this twice in the past to Lacie devices and both times they stopped working within a year. Return policy doesn't include data recovery within warranty period. Only covers replacement of damaged device. Must pay Lacie extra for data recovery. Seems kind of cheap a company would sell a product and then charge customer for data loss due to THEIR faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Zemin

customer_reviews.title: I use this for backup and to carry media on the go
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case because it's rugged and can handle the travel I do with it. I have a small HD on my laptop so I needed a device that can be powered from the port on the laptop and allow me to use it on the plane, at the airport, in the car or out in the middle of nowhere. It can take a fall with the rubber around, but I do take care of not dropping it too often or from a high distance, from about a sitting position to the carpet or grass.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Thomasian

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: I got sold two dud drives
customer_reviews.text: If I could leave less than 1 star I would. I bought two of these at the same time. I connected them to my MacBook Pro and noticed the capacity was only 430mb (screenshot attached) I opened up Disk Utility and sure enough, the capacity of both drives is only 430mb. I never got a code for the 1 Month of Adobe CC either. I got sold two dud drives.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Best drive for Filmmarker, Speed + Space at good price
customer_reviews.text: Very good disk, rought and fast. Raid 0 system is not for Backup, always than i use the disk i backup my data in another LaCie (5tb) and then upload all RAW to my Dropbox Business account. Drive only failed 1 time (Becouse more than 7 times my drive was connected and my friend disconnected it forcing drive cancel everything and get data corruption) backup all my files format and is like a charm nowdays
customer_reviews.author: Kelbin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on March 25th, received on March 28th, died on April 16th. Called Lacie tech support who told me that the sound it was making means that the drive failed and I shouldn't plug it into my Mac. Transferred me to data recovery who then informed me that I would have to pay $600 to get my files from the drive unless I had purchased the data recovery plan. So now I have a drive with files that are unusable. Looks good, but I would not recommend purchasing. Back to Sandisk I go!
customer_reviews.author: A. John

customer_reviews.title: Faulty - Mac not recognizing device
customer_reviews.text: I received this a couple days ago, and my computer will not recognize the device —I have a MacBook Air 2018. I have contacted Amazon support all for them to tell me to contact Lacie directly, however, there’s no place I can report my device that doesn’t turn on to Lacie, and they do not have a phone number. Now what?
customer_reviews.author: PoopSoup

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage, failed in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first and last drive I will buy from LaCie. Purchased primarily for Thunderbolt and to use for my primary Time Machine backup on my iMac. Was chugging along no problems for about six months than backups started taking forever. I erased the drive and started fresh. No problems again for about six months. Now will not complete a backup even after erasing the drive. Was trying to complete a backup for FIVE days. If the drive is going to fail in a year the price should be a reflection of the quality. I would say maybe $25 tops for this piece of junk. I would stay clear of these.
customer_reviews.author: David Prosser

customer_reviews.title: just incredibly slow. returning it now
customer_reviews.text: bought this with high expectations because of the thunderbolt option. Tried several times to use with time machine on my mac and it was just insanely slow and the drive was running hot all the time. Moreover, it starting shutting down once it got hot. i purchased this as a renewed product from amazon warehouse (ie renewed), and am not sure if this would be the issue even if purchased new. Anyways, I purchased another drive from seagate (who I believe make this device too) which supports just USB-3 (5 Gbps), but seems a lot lot faster than the Lacie. Overall, bad experience
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dreyfuss

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to accompany a new laptop because of their quality in the past. This configuration is utter garbage. The cord connection is faulty, causing it to come off with little movement of the drive or computer. New cords haven't fixed the issue as it is the build of the actual port. Once it disconnects due to the faulty cord port, it takes over 10 minutes to reconnect, sometimes up to 30 minutes, leaving you waiting to get back to the task you were trying to accomplish when it disconnected. In addition to the faulty cord port, it is a very slow drive. Will not support the company in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Shepherd Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase this product if you hope to ever see your files again.
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT purchase this product! It stopped interfacing with our computer after a couple of months of use. Tech support said there was nothing they could do. We were told we MIGHT be able to recover all the files for a minimum of $800. My son lost all of his portfolio projects stored on this piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk McPhearson

customer_reviews.title: Not travel ready, poor USB connection, Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: I've used LaCie drives for years (very dependable!) but this little drive has repeatedly dismounted improperly from a weak cable connection at the drive's USB port. Very disappointed. NOT travel worthy, NOT ready to even sit loose on a desk. To access my drive, I have currently have it balanced tilted on a pen and book to make sure there is enough pressure angled at the USB connection to make it stick. I'm hoping to replace with a drive with a built-in connection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but use with care
customer_reviews.text: My experience with it is mostly reliable, but sometimes it might be slow to load with Windows, if so just be patient - don't unplug without choosing the ejection (lower right taskbar) or you could cause some corruption, at least temporarily.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Talaska - Eco Neato

customer_reviews.title: So far and in comparison to my past G-drives, ...
customer_reviews.text: So far and in comparison to my past G-drives, this Lacie is a bit whiny in that you as much as blow on it while it is connected to the computer and you will get a pop up window stating "error of sorts" and/or instructions on how to connect/disconnect the drive even when you are not trying to or about to disconnect. It does hold 4T on it and for that I am grateful since I've been able to consolidate my other drives into one. Will see how the storage holds up overtime.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CRAP PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE PRODUCT. AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE. I purchased this item and the very first time I plugged it into my computer it displayed a bunch of error messages and would not function whatsoever. I contacted the company and they refuse to refund me my money or replace the product. WASTE OF TIME/MONEY.BUYERS BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: The Color Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Registration site currently non-functional
customer_reviews.text: The registration process is started with START_HERE_WIN.EXE which launches a web-site that doesn't work which prevents you from registering your product - and getting your warranty started or support software downloaded or whatever else they may have. That's great. It looks like the clown festival is about to begin and my tolerance for simple, required tasks failing to work is pretty low.
customer_reviews.author: Art_dude

customer_reviews.title: Solid - dependable - not as quick as I would have liked
customer_reviews.text: Desperately looking for an external hard drive to boot my Mac from temporarily until I could get it to the shop for a replacement hard drive. Seemed to take forever to install the backup, even using the thunderbolt connection. Will be good to have as a future portable backup, however!
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC DRIVE! LOOKS GREAT, FEELS GREAT, SUPER FAST!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is amazing. 4TB and can't beat that rugged quality. Some people hate the way the orange rubber looks, but I disagree. I think it looks great and makes it really easy to hold and see your drive while you are at a coffee shop, airport, even at home. Easy to setup and super fast. It is worth the extra money to get the thunderbolt connection because of how fast it transfers. Plan on buying another 4TB drive to be backup, but great work on this drive LaCie!
customer_reviews.author: Liam Goss

customer_reviews.title: Buy a GOLD-PLATED CONNECTOR cable, and you will LOVE your LaCie!
customer_reviews.text: Port connector was loose upon arrival and caused many transfer and connectivity problems. This may be why there are so many negative reviews. I upgraded my connection cable and now increasing my review from a 2 to a 5 star. LaCie really should just encourage people to buy cables with GOLD-PLATED CONNECTORS!!! Why mess around, and it's under $6! I bought this one and all issues with my LaCie were resolved:  Note, this is not a thunderbolt cable. Good luck!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yogimama

customer_reviews.title: Well pleased when using with newest Mac Mini
customer_reviews.text: Used to increase storage of new Mac Mini with only 256GB of its own. While performing programming duties, its response seems on a par with the Mac's own SSD. As I do not use the Mac for any higher performance tasks, I cannot comment on how it might perform if I did, The durability rating I gave was simply based on not having had any problems in the one month of ownership, but cannot address long-term what might become apparent.
customer_reviews.author: David Pressman

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought at least a dozen of LaCie HDs in the past. No more! The new HD is junk! It used to be a breeze to set it up, partition, and start using. Now I don't know what I have to do in order to be able to use this HD. They changed everything and now I have to spend time trying to figure out how to use the freaking HD! I have to download a toolkit (more garbage on my laptop!), and there still is no info on partitioning or anything whatsoever. The official website is of no use - there are no clear instructions either. VERY UNHAPPY! Will be returning this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: LaCie Lost All My Data
customer_reviews.text: I bought LaCie as an extra storage space for my photography business. To increase my computer's speed, I would put all my old sessions on there as well as some business information. Well, you can imagine my surprise when I go to get something out of it and it's no longer there. None of my data is on the drive anymore. The unit still "works" and it's been properly formatted for my Macbook, but all my stuff is gone. Cool.
customer_reviews.author: Anna H.

customer_reviews.title: Connector issues. Disconnects from my laptop frequently.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the LaCie Rugged Mini USB 3.0 / 2TB External Hard Drive because of the overall ratings and great reviews. When I worked in Purchasing, this was also the brand that was most frequently requested by employees. Having used it for over a year now, my biggest issue with it is the way it connects to my laptop (a MacBook Pro). It disconnects from my laptop frequently, which I find frustrating. I'm just now concerned that I'm going to have to transfer all the data before it becomes unusable, as others have reported. For the cost, I just expected more durability in its functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy this, I didnt listen to reviews, THEY ARE RIGHT.
customer_reviews.text: The drive broke within a month of *VERY CAREFUL* handling. PLEASE, DO NOT USE LACIE/SEAGATE. Their drives are really are terrible. And guess what if you want a replacement YOU have to pay for shipping costs THERE AND BACK. And they only send you a refurbished drive and if they lose any files of yours while its in their possession ITS YOUR PROBLEM, NOT theirs. Don't spend money to lose your hard earned work/ important files/memorie, for the love of god use a different brand. Do your future self a HUGE favor and AVOID this ABSURDLY BAD product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Drive won't stay mounted, warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: This drive won't stay mounted when the orange sleeve is on. Had this issue on arrival. The sleeve prevents the USB cable from making a secure connection. It will sporadically disconnect and reconnect to my computer. I've tried multiple cables, other computers, the issue is the drive. I contacted Lacie because this seems like something that should fall under warranty. They said it is not and they can't do anything about it. Awesome. So glad I wasted my money. Hopefully you read this and don't do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea R.

customer_reviews.title: Just as slow as a regular external hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because of the advertised super fast speed. Transfer speeds are about 5mb/s. Advertised as up to 250 mb/s. Will be returning as soon as I find a better replacement. Also, doesn't work if not plugged into an outlet. So you have two cables to carry around all the time. One wall plug and one USB for computer. Doesn't work plugging directly into PC or Laptop. This is not mentioned in listing anywhere....
customer_reviews.author: dimitri

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drive, but for one major problem. The cable is continually falling out, and obviously this causes major problems. I've tried adding a USB extension cable so that it can sit further away from me with less chance of it possibly getting nudged, but it hasn't helped. If it weren't for this, I would be giving it 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: D. N. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: This is our third LaCie Thunderbolt portable HD (we have multiple computers), and I love its durability and reliability. It's small and relatively light, and I keep one as a backup drive (only connecting it for periodic backups), just in case those connected to the computer(s) get fried from sudden power surges or other electrical issues. Wouldn't use any other brand because this one has been solid for us!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Olson

customer_reviews.title: Failed after less that a year!
customer_reviews.text: I lost a lot of back up data. I would not recommend buying unless you also buy a replacement plan that would retrieve lost data. There is no way to get my data back after calling them for help.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Yooo Stop Lying... This Drive is SLOW
customer_reviews.text: The reviews had me convienced. But then I realized I was bamboozled. This thing peaks out at 30MB on my 2019 Macbook Pro. It's so brtually slow I've had to relucantly use it just as a secondary backup. Do NOT buy this if you are looking for speed fam. This !@#! is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. DJ Tek

customer_reviews.title: LaCie 5TB Rugged Thunderbolt / USB-C Mobile External Hard Drive,
customer_reviews.text: Advantages: Very fast transfer rate, USBC is great for direct connection to later MACBOOK PRO computers, small and very portable. Able to backup computer and then moved to a secure place to prevent theft or electrical surge. I would prefer the Thunderbolt cable be removable. It is permanently attached.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Stafford

customer_reviews.title: 0 KB?
customer_reviews.text: What I ordered was supposed to have 2TB, but I am currently unable to use it and my utilities, erasing, etc. have not proved helpful. It shows I only have 0KB?! Total waste of money. I'm ordering from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Jana J. Monji

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: I have used LaCie products in the past without any failure. I had to reformat this device a second time after someone else formatted it so I don't know if they did it right the first time. It was also missing one of the wires that was supposed to be in the box. It is only a $8 wire but it would have been nice to have it.
customer_reviews.author: research

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this drive for a film shoot. I have many LaCie rugged drives but decided to buy this one on Amazon for the quick shipping. Plugged in using both cables provided to my MBP. Didn't show up on desktop or finder. Opened disk utilities and wasn't showing up there either. Dug deeper and found my macbook wasn't even reading the drive being plugged in even though I could tell the drive was powering up. Should have listened to the other reviews and will never be buying hard drives online again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Tech support is really lacking
customer_reviews.text: So far I havn't been able to use this product because neither my imac or ipad will recognize the external hard drive. I've called tech support numerous times as instructed by the website but no one answers. I just completed an email request and they told me they would get back to me within a day. I'll revisit this review if and when we get the external hard drive working.
customer_reviews.author: David Hallene

customer_reviews.title: shipped as described
customer_reviews.text: it works and its a good external drive if you need one but read/write speed i would have bought a higher end model if i had known how low the read write speed really was it took over 3 days so just 0 write the disk... i am security conscious but the vender would be more respectable if they listed the read write speed.. i thought i got a deal... the discount comes from the slow read/write speed on the disk... its good if you just want a backup.. not my first choice for something more dynamic but then again its still an HDD not an SSD. you get what you pay for..
customer_reviews.author: thomas penner considine

customer_reviews.title: Horribly Slow. Disk rattles.
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive is painfully slow, and the hard disk rattles as if it is about to fail. The USB-3 connector produces data transfers that remind me of the days of the floppy disk. I have used La Cie drives for years with complete satisfaction until now. This item was a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: If my memory serves me right...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a WD My Passport that gave out seemingly out of nowhere, after a good amount of time, but with very light use. Anyway, I had seen this product, ubiquitous in many tech sites, and decided to give it a go. I've had it for a little while now and I am happy with it. It came formatted for my Mac and for what I use it for, I couldn't ask for more. It looks good, it works well, and it's supposed to be durable. However, I am not keen on testing the durability of my tech toys. Watching people throw their devices around to test their cases is too much for me.
customer_reviews.author: TCantu

customer_reviews.title: reliable, small and rugged
customer_reviews.text: I like that the thunderbolt and USB-C connection will work when I finally upgrade to a new Mac after my laptop, a late 2011 Macbook Pro finally croaks, though it's just slow, not really failing. I bought two of these and rotate them as A & B time machine backup drives. I sleep well at night. I bought one of these several years ago as a backup/archive drive. Still going strong though I am careful to never move it while it's running. And the cost of SSC drives these spinning drives are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Very Slow Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first LaCie drive, and so far I am underwhelmed. The data transfer speed is by far the SLOWEST I've ever experienced with an external drive. Almost twice as long as any WD drive. I wanted to try this brand cause I was curious..now I know better. returning this turtle
customer_reviews.author: A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive did not work. It only held 1 TB of Data not the 2 TB Of data it claims to hold. This Hard drive got so hot I burned my finger when I touched it. I would recommend that you do not but this product. and if you do, Do not ever touch it has you will get 3rd degree burns on whatever part of your body that comes in contact with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: WORKS 100%
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one i had for over 5 years with no issues. I do video works and it's working very well transferring large size files
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Issue
customer_reviews.text: Mine failed after 28 months. Called Seagate. Only 12 months replacement warranty. They offered to do a onetime replacement all I had to do was pay shipping to them ($8.50, First Class US Mail, $100 insurance). They returned 2 weeks later via UPS Ground. Great Service,
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lang

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate, buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a really bad experience with hard drives, I’ve dropped one and it stopped working. I’ve also had one that I’ve left on for a long period of time and it overheated and died. With no recovery due to the blades inside completely failing, I’ve came across lacie and had this for over 5 months now. No issues yet!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: LaCie Drives are the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these portable, impact resistant hard drives from LaCie. They work well, are very durable. I don't know if there are better drives out there which are as reliable and durable as these!
customer_reviews.author: John B. Goode

customer_reviews.title: Starting to not sync with computers
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this harddrive for a month and a half but the device is having difficulty being seen by computers. If I do not have it upright and the cord positioned a certain way multiple computers do not actually see the device and there is no orange light that indicates that it is in use. Now I do not want to continue using the device as I am afraid i will lose the files on it if one day I can not get it to sync at all. Not impressed by this "rugged" hard drive at all.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I used this hard drive for about a year before it died on me because I guess I had it plugged into the computer for too long? I had it plugged in overnight as I was editing video. Anyway, I've tried everything, and I can't get it up and running again. It beeps and it can't be mounted on my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: @arabelladelucco

customer_reviews.title: OLD Hardware, Died Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Tried to back up files, it died immediately. Don't buy. It didn't even copy that many files before it just DIED. It doesn't even show up now, the computer can't find it when I plug it in, it's fully dead... They should stop selling this, HDD is no good these days. Do yourself a favor and get SSD. HDD is the ancient tech from the 1990s. SSD is modern.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Gilson

customer_reviews.title: No issues, great for backups.
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these drives in light use for the last two months. No issues to speak of. I like how it came with Adobe CC for a free month each drive, nice surprise. It’s very likely that buying a hard drive online is a gamble given postal workers rough handling. Not sure why a drive would stop working so quickly as some reviewers have suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron C.

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months - no longer working
customer_reviews.text: This portable hard drive was highly recommended to me, so I bought 2. One drive works like a dream. The second drive just stopped working after 6 months!!!! So unfair. Luckily, I did back it up - but for the price, I expected a much better product. I have my fingers crossed for the second one - will back that up too. So unfair!
customer_reviews.author: Sincere

customer_reviews.title: This item stopped working 2 weeks after purchasing it. ...
customer_reviews.text: This item stopped working 2 weeks after purchasing it. I was going to return it when it randomly started working again. I made the mistake of not returning it because it stopped working another week after that. I lost a lot of photos that could not be recovered. If you have purchased this item and it starts beeping that means the hard drive is crashing. Transfer what you can and return it. I would not purchase another hard drive from LaCie again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product is defective! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I ordered this external hard drive. Both times it was defective. It only has 400mb, not 4TB! I thought the first time was a fluke. However, when it happened again after I received the second one, I realized something is really wrong here. I even called Apple tech support twice, thinking I did something wrong. Nope! It's the hard drive. It's faulty. Save yourself the aggravation and heartache and do not bother!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Lynn Debrone

customer_reviews.title: Slower than USB 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and looked good and preformated exFAT. Copied over 2 TB of videos and took more than 1 day fluctuating between 12-24 MB/s. Box said 800MB video transfer in 10 sec. That's 80 MB/s at 5400RPM. I'm WAY under that. Not sure why it's so slow. So...good with storage capacity and size...but horrible for speed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Road Tough
customer_reviews.text: Used this hard drive for 2 years now. I DJ at least 5 times a week a this thing just keeps right up. I’m going to be ordering another to have a backup drive.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lytle

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Super frustrated. When it worked, it worked fast. But now it's suddenly unwritable and can't save anything onto it. I have over 2TB of photography on it and I don't have another device large enough for me to drop the files onto in order to return it - a bit at a loss. I've spent hours trying to research on their site and figure out how to fix it, but no idea. I wrote an email to seagate for help- haven't heard back yet. It has totally stopped my workflow.
customer_reviews.author: Mango

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer and use these a ton! I have never had an issue with these breaking and I have had issues in the past with hard drives failing me. I love how easily you can bring these on the go. I am a very busy photographer that needs to have hard drives with me on the go. Haven't found a comparable hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Claire A

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: This thing crapped out on me after 3 months. Luckily, I didn't store much on it during that time. It's completely non-op. Rugged my a$$.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Wordsmith

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive; HORRIBLE customer service
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive is great in every way. No complaints about that. However, the La Cie customer service is terrible. I tried to call them for help with setting up encryption of the hard drive, but the number listed in the user manual is inoperable. Their online support is just as poor. Still haven't figured out how to encrypt the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Pankey

customer_reviews.title: LaCie back-up
customer_reviews.text: The product is good; not great but good. The things I didn't like and what would not make me buy from this company again - the instructions are not for laypersons nor is the manual. And, if you actually want to talk to someone, it'll never happen. No phone numbers are listed on their site and the number that turned up on an internet search, has been busy for days.
customer_reviews.author: Joy L.

customer_reviews.title: Kinda broken
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot and handy but is constantly coming disconnected from my USB. Tried another USB, and it's the external hard drive. Too expensive to fix that one part so I have to buy a new one. Can't use it unless I'm completely still. And it'll still come disconnected. Now it crashed
customer_reviews.author: Astrid Kallsen

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions!
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive itself looks OK. The serial number was on the box with tiny fonts, The installation instruction was on the hard cover making it hard to file -very annoying . If i knew this, and read all the reviews in details, I would not have bought.. It seemed few buyers are not happy with the operating experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Sidpara

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Mounting
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was using the LaCie for photo storage, but it stopped mounting onto our Macs after only a couple months -- with all of her photos on it. Thankfully, we had a backup, but this could have been a disaster. I do not recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Pretty drive, terrible wired connection - A Big Let Down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external hard drive because of its promise to uphold against a range of rugged tasks, which is important to me as my job involves moving around large bodies of water. With so much supposed attention to design, this external hard drive is effectively nonfunctioning because of its flimsy cord and stupid connection. This may work for someone who doesn't get bumped around very much, but then what's the point of the "rugged" external hard drive. I'm very disappointed and very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Lee-Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Lacie is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed and shipped fast. Lacie is my favorite go to for external hard drives, I've never had an issue with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mspt109

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Durable
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to tote back and forth to work which now includes a lot of video editing (thanks covid!) This is great feels durable and has about 3 months of 4-6 hours of classes each day recorded on it and is not even halfway full. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: This Brand stands the test of time
customer_reviews.text: These drives are indeed super sturdy and robust. I have many of these drives that still work great after many years of multiple reformatting and reusing. They are also compact enough to carry around easily. These are reliable unlike many others.
customer_reviews.author: The Big H

customer_reviews.title: Best external brand on the market
customer_reviews.text: My go to drive for all my photography back ups. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Axel

customer_reviews.title: Rugged unit
customer_reviews.text: The robust construction of the case instills confidence that the electronics work well also.
customer_reviews.author: F Ben Kautz

customer_reviews.title: Great of backups.  Definitely rugged and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love having a few back up drives and really love how rugged this one is. I don't purposely drop it but if I did, it would last. It's super easy to use and holds 4tb...a ton of files and data. Glad I have it as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Alexa

customer_reviews.title: All I get is a blinking light.
customer_reviews.text: Drive worked great for about 8 months on Mac and Windows. All I get now when I connect it to either platform is a blinking light, but it never appears on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Shillingford

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little bigger than I expected BUT it’s not crazy that it isn’t portable. It’ll fit in your back pocket. Honestly I only use them as my backup drives for when I’m traveling. They’re pretty fast to use while editing videos/ pictures too.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

product_meta.title: LaCie LAC9000298 Rugged Mini 2TB External Hard Drive Portable HDD - USB 3.0 USB 2.0 Compatible, Drop Shock Dust Rain Resistant Shuttle Drive, for Mac and PC Computer Desktop Workstation PC Laptop
product_meta.description: Capacity:2TB| Style:Mini USB 3.0Travel with a capacity of 2TB in an ultra compact portable hard drive—LaCie Rugged Mini. Seamlessly connect to USB 3. 0 computers, transfer content fast with speeds of up to 130MB/s, and trek confidently with all terrain durability of drop, crush, and rain resistance. This drive even includes a complimentary one month membership to the Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps Plan for access to awesome photo and video editing apps, as well as a two year limited for long term peace of mind.
feature_bullets: Travel with massive capacity of up to 5TB in an ultra compact portable external hard Drive
For those who have a need for Speed, seamlessly connect to USB 3. 0 computers and transfer content Fast with speeds of up to 130MB/s
Trek confidently with an external Hard Drive that offers all terrain durability of drop, crush, and water resistance
Take advantage of a complimentary 1 month membership to the Adobe creative cloud all apps plan for access to awesome photo and video editing apps
Enjoy long term peace of mind with the included 2 year limited

specifications.Operating System: Latest version of Windows® 7 or later / Mac OS® X 10.5 or later
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,141 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
